---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [cf006102bb](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17095/commits/cf006102bb2f96e50a9cb9feebe0f1b51be02bb7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

:v: Ruben-VandeVelde can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11119207141/job/30894020535)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11119207141/job/30894020895)
bors d+
Thanks!
bors d+

```suggestion
  simp_rw [‚Üê ofReal_cpow ht.le, RCLike.ofReal_mul, coe_algebraMap]
```
I guess this should work, and it's a bit tidier
What's the justification for this change? I was under the impression that named cases are preferred to anonymous ones?
I'm not sure that's a rule, and in any case I don't think the `inr` name from `wlog` is intentional or even a good name.
I don't like it but that's a fair point :)
What's the justification for this change? `rcases`, unlike `cases'`, is encouraged syntax.

I'm not sure if the case names from `rcases` are stable; in any case there's no advantage to using `rcases` here, and separating the case names from the names of the introduced hypotheses is less readable, IMO.

The case names from `rcases` correspond exactly with the case names from `cases`, so this change doesn't affect stability in that sense. There's also no advantage to using `cases` here, the introduced hypotheses aren't referred to by name in the proof.

And in later cases, the `rfl` syntax for `rcases` makes the proof clearer and simpler to read, so there is a stronger advantage which is not allowed with the `cases` proof. In other words, I'm not sure that this change is a "tidy", in fact a PR doing the opposite and using `rfl` to simplify the proof is something I'd be more happy to merge as a tidy!
I've dropped the case-related changes from this PR

```suggestion
                  ¬∑ exact measure_mono <| iUnion_subset <|
                      fun i ‚Ü¶ iUnion_subset fun _ ‚Ü¶ subset_iUnion f i
```
looks like it should work?
What's going on here? Was this a heavy-rfl before?
Not so heavy, but seeing through several definitions, so this should be more robust.

```suggestion
    LocallyIntegrableOn f s Œº ‚Üî ‚àÄ (k : Set X), k ‚äÜ s ‚Üí IsCompact k ‚Üí IntegrableOn f k Œº := by
```
optional but seems in spirit with this PR!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: tidy various files
